intro: Apodostigma pallens var. pallens, commonly known as the pale apodostigma, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. The plant has a short, upright stem with opposite, ovate leaves that are usually smooth and glossy. Its flowers are borne in umbellate inflorescences, a feature typical of the Araliaceae family. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a threatened species in its natural range.
